metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6500 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Inappropriate implementation in interstitials in Google Chrome prior to80.0.3987.87 allowed a remote attacker to spoof the contents of the Omnibox(URL bar) via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6500` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 80.0.3987.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 80.0.3987.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 80.0.3987.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 80.0.3987.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 80.0.3987.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '80.0.3987.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
